content.rendered:
What is an Engineering Technologist?

Engineering Technologists are specialists of certain aspects pertaining to the creation and implementation of their specific focus of engineering. 

Where does an Engineering Technologist work?

  • Product development sites
  • Laboratories

How much does an Engineering Technologist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Engineering Technologist is $50,991.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Engineering Technologists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing Engineering Technologist jobs.

  • Mechanical engineering majors
  • Civil engineering majors
  • Electrical engineering majors

Engineering Technologists skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Engineering Technologists succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Understanding of engineering practices
  • Strong technical skills

What are some common questions about Engineering Technologists?

Q: Can an Engineering Technologist become an engineer?

A: Yes! At the beginning you will be assisting a lot of seasoned engineers, but with time and growth it’s possible to become an engineer in the future.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming an Engineering Technologist.
